frameDefinitions: An Entity comes into existence at a particular Place and Time which may take a certain Duration_of_endstate, have a Cause, or be formed from Components.
This frame consists of words that indicate the change of an Item's position on a scale (the Attribute) from a starting point (Initial_value) to an end point (Final_value).
An Entity changes from a Prior_state to a Post_state in a sequence that follows a pre-defined plan, expectation, or model of change.
The number of entities that make up the Set changes from an Initial_number to a Final_number.
The adjectives and nouns in this frame are all based on the idea that mental properties may be attributed to a person (Protagonist) by a (usually implicit)
An Agent occupies a Role in some institution.
frameExamples: Problems may <t>arise</t> whenever an S1 sophont enters the game.
Hawke's Bay winery <t>doubled</t> in size last year.
Their offensive armament has <t>developed</t> from short range missiles to long-range ballistic weaponry in a relatively short period .
How has the <t>proliferation</t> of cellular telephones affected your amateur mobile operation? INI INI
It was <t>stupid</t> of me to do that.
Chris <t>served</t> as chairman of the boardfor one year.
listRoleDefinitions: Concrete or abstract entity that did not exist before the <fen>Time</fen> of the event.
This role identifes the Time when a new Entity comes into existence.
This is the Place where the new Entity comes into being.
The <fen>Attribute</fen> is a scalar property that the <fen>Item</fen> possesses.
The entity that has a position on the scale.
The distance by which an <fen>Item</fen> changes its position on the scale.
The position on the scale where the <fen>Item</fen> ends up.
The initial position on the scale from which the <fen>Item</fen> moves away.
A portion of the scale, typically identified by its end points, along which the values of the <fen>Attribute</fen> fluctuate.
A description that presents the <fen>Item</fen>'s state before the change in the <fen>Attribute</fen>'s value as an independent predication.
A description that presents the <fen>Item</fen>'s state after  the change in the <fen>Attribute</fen>'s value as an independent predication.
The <fen>Time</fen> is the time-frame in which the change of position occurs.
A location where Attribute is measured
The object that undergoes change.
The time at which the progress occurs.
The location where the Progress occurs.
The group of entities, possibly construed as a collective, whose number changes.
The number of entities by which the <fen>Set</fen> increases or decreases.
The number of entities in the <fen>Set</fen> afterwards.
The initial number of entities in the <fen>Set</fen>.
A description that presents the <fen>Set</fen>'s state before the change in the number of entities making it up as an independent predication.
A description that presents the <fen>Set</fen>'s state after  the change in the <fen>Attribute</fen>'s value as an independent predication.
The <fen>Time</fen> is the time-frame in which the change in number occurs.
A location where the <fen>Set</fen> changes in number.

This is the person (or people) to whom a mental property is attributed. The role may be expressed as External Argument of a predicative use of the adjective, as a PP Complement, or as the head noun modified by an attributive use of the adjective:

The <fen>Behavior</fen> refers to any action, utterance, belief, or artifact thereof on the basis of which a mental property is attributed to the <fen>Protagonist</fen>. The meaning of the English word <ment>behavior</ment> should not be taken to constrain the identity of this frame element too much---conceptually, this frame element includes things that would not normally be described using the word <ment>behavior</ment>.  Note the following examples:

Some of the words in this frame have a slightly different use in that they evaluate someone only with respect to their mental performance in some particular domain or capacity.  We call this domain or capacity <t>Practice</t>. E.g., She is <t>astute</t> <fex name='Practice'>at math</fex>. Note that this does not mean she is considered to be astute in general for doing math. Rather, she is astute with respect to math, but may be dumb with respect to other things. These uses probably belong in a different frame with words such as <ment>skilled</ment>, but for the time being they are marked with the role Practice. General Grammatical Observations:  The adjectives in this frame may exhibit Extraposition of a <ment>to</ment>-marked infinitive VP, with an optional Protagonist expressed in an <ment>of</ment>-PP: It was <t>brilliant</t> (of you) <fex name='Prac'>to invite the clowns to the party</fex>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the entity that occpuies the <fen>Role</fen>.
The <fen>Role</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> occupies.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> served in the <fen>Role</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> served in the <fen>Role</fen>.
listRoleExamples: I fear <fex>this service</fex> will diminish in quality.
Diesels have increased <fex>from having a 20% market share in 1995</fex> to just over 30% in 2004.

It was never bad (1 or 2 seizures a year), but this past decade, it has increased
<fex>to having them 1 day a month</fex> and on that 1 day I have 6 or 7 seizures.
Advances <fex>in marketing techniques</fex> have since rendered it obsolete.
<fex>When</fex> did the X-wing progress beyond the drawing board?
<fex>The union's membership</fex> has dwindled from 1.5 million in 1979 to a little more than 600000 today.
Jaffna's student population has dwindled <fex>by more than a hundred</fex>.
Church of England baptisms have dwindled from 365000 in 1940 <fex>to 150000 in 1995</fex>.
The number of Medline searches has greatly proliferated <fex>from 7 million</fex> to 120 million.
The human population has dwindled <fex>from being world dominators</fex> to simple survivors.
Oh, my aching software: Worms and viruses proliferated <fex>in 2003</fex>.
<fex>You</fex> were smart to save all your receipts.
